New Records: Slovakia's win marked the biggest upset by FIFA ranking differential in Euro history, with a 45-spot difference between Belgium (No. 3) and Slovakia (No. 48).
Key Match Events: Ivan Schranz scored the seventh-minute goal that proved decisive.
Romelu Lukaku had two goals ruled out by VAR in the second half.
DÃ¡vid Hancko saved a goal on the goal line, sustaining a face injury from a teammate's knee.
Pre-Game Insights: Slovakia was a +600 underdog, while Belgium was a -210 favorite before the match.
This was Belgium's first loss under coach Domenico Tedesco.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium fell to their first loss in 15 games under Tedesco.
Slovakia prepared for their next match against Ukraine with an extra day of rest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was notable for its betting upset and historical significance in FIFA ranking differential.
